reviews.text: I have stayed in this Hilton a few times over the year on business. There are some good things about it, and some not so good.
reviews.title: Would not be my first choice

reviews.text: Pros: great friendly staff, always eager to help. Provides frequent complimentary shuttle service to downtown and major shopping areas. Room refurbishment underway, love the fancy Japanese style toilet.
reviews.title: They had no rooms.

reviews.text: Cons: location, sadly a major setback that can't be changed. The hotel is up on a hill that is a good 15 min walk from a relatively lively intersection. But if you don't speak Korean, communication will be a challenge from stores in that area.
reviews.title: Old hotel but good location

reviews.text: Yes, the lack of in-room wifi really sucks. Honestly at this day and age, it's simply unacceptable for a Hilton-brand hotel. I hope they can fix that asap.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was lucky enough to get a renovated room this time. No question an upgrade from the old room. Personally the lack of bathtub is not a huge problem, but maybe to some. I also find the room lacks personality, and the harsh lighting from the sink area affects the ambiance of the room greatly.
reviews.title: Nice but out of the way
Is not a "Grand" hotel at all!
reviews.text: Old, badly maintance, room is very old, bed is very hard, pillow is not comfortable. Receptionist very rude, no eye contact when answering quentions. We requested a connecting room as we are travelling with young children but the receptionist simply answer "No more room!" without even checking her computer. We later call the manager and she immediately change us to a connecting room. The next moring we found the the coffee shop was only 1/3 full - so how can they have a full house if the coffee shop was not full. The whole hotel was also very empty !!! This Hotel location is off from major attraction and shopping area. Stay at other Hotel when visit S

The Grand Hilton Seoul sadly doesn't live up to its name. Although the lobby is pretty impressive the rooms are quite a let down. The decor is beige in every since and very blah! Although everything works pretty well and its as clean as anywhere, the rooms and bathrooms (though large) are just depressingly outdated.
reviews.title: More Okay than Grand.
Ummm YAH
reviews.text: I also found the bed to be extremely hard and ended up lying on a pillow to cushion my poor body... didn't make for the most relaxing sleep!
The staff were good- professional and friendly, no complaints there. In fact everyone was extremely friendly, bowing and greeting you wherever you met.
reviews.title: Great service, ok room

reviews.text: My colleagues were very pleased with the buffet breakfast but I skipped it. I had a club-sandwich in my room, which was ok but nothing special, especially for the high price.
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel

reviews.text: As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel does not have wifi. This is aggravating, but it is solvable with some software. For Windows 7 PCs, there is a program called "Connectify" which turns your laptop into a wifi hotspot. This worked great and allowed my iPhone to use the connection in the room. Good thing the company was paying for internet though, because it was $19/day.
reviews.title: Decent business hotel. Solved the wifi problem.

reviews.text: As others have mentioned, some rooms are a bit tired. However, they had a note in my room indicating they were upgrading some of the furnishings soon, so perhaps in a few months it will be nicer. The rooms were plenty big, but the bed was pretty hard.
reviews.title: no wireless internet, no deal for a business hotel

reviews.text: The location is interesting. Lots of good walking and hiking opportunities nearby. Look for the water wheel along the stream path. If you take the water wheel trail, you can get to the top of Ansan Mountain which offers a panoramic city view. The hike taxes about 1-1.5 hours round trip from the hotel.
reviews.title: OK for conference

reviews.text: Many restaurants and conveniences are nearby. This is definitely a working class neighborhood and the restaurants definitely cater to the locals, but they are still welcoming to foreigners. The subway is about a 15-minute walk. No nightlife nearby, but taxis are very cheap in Seoul and relatively easy to catch. Make sure you ask for a "take me to my hotel" card from the front desk. This made it much easier to get a taxi back.
reviews.title: Great hotel but poor location for city visit

reviews.text: Overall the hotel is comfortable and clean, and getting around the city wasn't too much trouble.
reviews.title: good service

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights on business. Adequate rooms, decent restaurants, and the executive lounge was OK. Service was good. Biggest drawback is the location. Far from the city center.
reviews.title: Average hotel in poor location

reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about the hotel after reading the reviews and was expecting the worst. But after staying at the hotel for 3 nights, i felt that the hotel was ok. The room's quite large and very clean. It is also fairly comfortable. I didn't encounter any problems when i was staying there. The only problem is that it is a little far from city centre - about 15min by taxi. And taxi drivers may accidentally mistake the hotel with Hilton Millenium Seoul. There is also not much of a nice view from my room, but i didn't really mind.
reviews.title: Just Like A Grand Old Lady

reviews.text: Overall, i would rate the hotel as a 4-star one which is rather comfortable, albeit located at a rather inconvenient spot.
reviews.title: Old Hilton Hotel Re-evaluate your options

reviews.text: I satyed for one night at this hotel, it is quite old in all aspects and not in a good location as well.
reviews.title: OK for business

reviews.text: the hotel staff needs to be trained further at their sister hotel Hilton Millinieum as there is big difference in the overall staff.
reviews.title: Old, outdated
